page.title: 13The Star Inn,Alfriston
page.content:
The Star Inn dates back to about 1450 and is one of the oldest inns in the country. It is a timber framed hotel which stands on Alfriston High Street.
Of the 32 bedrooms,many of which are in the extension on the back of the building,two are in the original building and have low timber beamed ceilings. The original building also includes two lounges and a bar which is open to non _ residents.
Every room has its own private bathroom and the hotel is generally fully booked in the summer. It is popular with foreigners and American tourists appreciate the bedrooms in the original building. It caters mainly for people touring by car and is often used by people attending the Glyndebourne Festival.
